headline: Productivity needed from AI to justify high valuations, expert says
summary: STORY: Shares of Nvidia, Microsoft and Alphabet ended higher on Wednesday as investors shifted back into AI stocks following recent worries they were overvalued.But going into 2026, Browne said he would like to see "tangible gains in productivity [from AI]" that would help "justify some of the current valuations."But "if we don't see that," cautioned Browne, "then we think markets may start to pay more and more attention to the rich valuations that are out there and ask themselves, 'is this all making sense?'"

headline: Alphabet’s Market Cap Rallies Past Apple for First Time in Nearly Seven Years
summary: Alphabet shares rose 2.4% Wednesday, putting the Google parent ahead of Apple as the second largest U.S. company by market capitalization.  Alphabet's gains gave the company a market value of $3.89 trillion, compared with Apple's $3.85 trillion, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  The last time Alphabet was the second largest company by market cap was 2018.

headline: China asks tech firms to halt orders for Nvidia's H200 chips, Information reports
summary: Beijing has asked some Chinese tech companies ​to halt orders for ‌Nvidia's H200 chips this week and ‌may mandate domestic AI chip purchases, the Information reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the ⁠matter.  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said at the Consumer Electronics Show ​this week that demand in ‌China for its H200 chip was strong.  Late last year, U.S. President Donald Trump's administration approved the export of H200 chips ⁠to China, a significant ​reversal of previous ​bans on advanced AI hardware.

headline: Hyundai shares hit record high amid Nvidia tie-up speculation
summary: STORY: Shares in Hyundai Motors hit a record high on Wednesday (January 7), jumping almost 15% in morning trade. That’s as market speculation grew about a deeper tie-up with Nvidia.On Monday, Hyundai’s Boston Dynamics debuted its humanoid robot Atlas at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas. And Hyundai has announced plans to deploy these next-generation robots in its factories.But a leading analyst said this move didn't fully explain the stock rally.Markets noted a meeting between the South Korean automaker’s chair Euisin Chung and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang at the CES event.One analyst said investors might believe the two companies' partnership could extend beyond a chip supply relationship. Which could lead to investments in Hyundai affiliates and give upside to share growth at the carmaker.

headline: AI ‘Fatigue’ Leaves Investors Focused on S&P’s Other 493 Stocks
summary: A growing number of investors are now wagering that run, led by the Magnificent Seven, is about to end.  Mounting concerns about AI’s ability to deliver seismic changes on the American economy — and the fat profits that would come with them — has turned investor euphoria about the technology into agita.  “I call it ‘AI fatigue,’” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at the eponymous Yardeni Research.

headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Sandisk Flies Higher
summary: Sandisk soared 28% and is now up almost 900% since its spinoff from Western Digital in February.  Western Digital gained 17% and Seagate rose 14%.  Huang discussed a new memory-storage platform for Nvidia's latest artificial-intelligence server system, into which it has integrated a host of connectivity and memory-storage products.

Huang discussed a new memory-storage platform for Nvidia's latest artificial-intelligence server system, into which it has integrated a host of connectivity and memory-storage products.

headline: Samsung Bulls Bet Record Earnings Will Extend $350 Billion Rally
summary: Its shares are beating those of SK Hynix Inc. so far in 2026, after three years of stark underperformance as the smaller rival gained favor with key customer Nvidia Corp. Now expectations of progress in AI along with huge price hikes for memory chips are driving calls that “Samsung is back.”  Samsung shares rose as much as 4% on Wednesday after Nvidia Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang highlighted a “completely unserved” market for AI data storage.

raw.headline: Samsung Bulls Bet Record Earnings Will Extend $350 Billion Rally
raw.summary: Its shares are beating those of SK Hynix Inc. so far in 2026, after three years of stark underperformance as the smaller rival gained favor with key customer Nvidia Corp. Now expectations of progress in AI along with huge price hikes for memory chips are driving calls that “Samsung is back.”  Samsung shares rose as much as 4% on Wednesday after Nvidia Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang highlighted a “completely unserved” market for AI data storage.

headline: Lenovo unveils Nvidia AI partnership, Qira platform
summary: STORY: :: Las Vegas, Nevada:: January 6, 2026:: Lenovo teams with Nvidia to speed up data center setup for AI cloud providers:: Yang Yuanqing, Lenovo CEO"We are launching the Lenovo AI Cloud Gigafactory with Nvidia. It works with, thank you, it works with a new Rubin platform you just announced yesterday.":: The world's top PC maker also debuted Qira, a cross-device AI superagent for Lenovo and Motorola users"Lenovo Qira works on your phone, PC, tablet or wearable, wherever you need AI to be. It works across platforms, from Windows to Android.""Lenovo Qira is truly a perceptive AI. It's keenly aware of its surroundings. It interacts with you however you want to. What do you like or dislike? Lenovo Qira remembers. What do you might need next, it anticipates."The world's largest personal computer maker, which also makes servers, made the announcement at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas while also showcasing an AI platform, concept devices and the first foldable smartphone under its Motorola brand.Under the data center program, Lenovo said it will offer its liquid-cooled hybrid AI infrastructure alongside Nvidia's computing platforms to help AI cloud providers reduce deployment time to "weeks."

It works across platforms, from Windows to Android.""Lenovo Qira is truly a perceptive AI. It's keenly aware of its surroundings. It interacts with you however you want to. What do you like or dislike? Lenovo Qira remembers. What do you might need next, it anticipates."The world's largest personal computer maker, which also makes servers, made the announcement at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas while also showcasing an AI platform, concept devices and the first foldable smartphone under its Motorola brand.Under the data center program, Lenovo said it will offer its liquid-cooled hybrid AI infrastructure alongside Nvidia's computing platforms to help AI cloud providers reduce deployment time to "weeks."

headline: China's Hesai to Supply Lidar Sensors to Nvidia
summary: Nvidia has picked Chinese lidar maker Hesai as its laser technology partner. Its co-founder and CEO David Li says the partnership is good news for global OEMs as the platform will streamline software, hardware and data in its autonomous driving product. He spoke with Bloomberg's Annabelle Droulers from the sidelines of CES in Las Vegas.

headline: Hyundai Motor shares rise 15% to hit record high amid Nvidia tie-up speculation
summary: Shares of Hyundai Motor rallied on Wednesday by as much ​as 14.9% to hit a record high ‌in morning trade, outperforming the benchmark KOSPI's 1.2% gain amid ‌market speculation about a potential deeper tie-up with Nvidia.  Shin Yoon-chul, an analyst at Kiwoom Securities, said Hyundai's announcement about the planned deployment in its factories ⁠of Atlas humanoid ‌robots, made at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, was insufficient to ‍fully explain the rally.  However, he said investor expectations appeared to be rising that Hyundai Motor Group's partnership with Nvidia could extend beyond a simple chip supply relationship, following  a meeting between Hyundai Motor ⁠Group Chair Euisun Chung and ​Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang ​at CES.

raw.headline: Hyundai Motor shares rise 15% to hit record high amid Nvidia tie-up speculation

Shin Yoon-chul, an analyst at Kiwoom Securities, said Hyundai's announcement about the planned deployment in its factories ⁠of Atlas humanoid ‌robots, made at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, was insufficient to ‍fully explain the rally.  However, he said investor expectations appeared to be rising that Hyundai Motor Group's partnership with Nvidia could extend beyond a simple chip supply relationship, following  a meeting between Hyundai Motor ⁠Group Chair Euisun Chung and ​Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang ​at CES.

headline: Oracle’s Debt-Fueled AI Data Center Bet Could Be A Game Changer For Oracle (ORCL)
summary: In recent months, Oracle has doubled down on AI-focused cloud infrastructure, ramping capital spending, expanding data centers, and deepening ties with major AI customers like OpenAI, Meta, Nvidia, and TikTok’s U.S. operations while adopting Nvidia’s new Rubin platform. At the same time, investors are increasingly focused on Oracle’s rising debt, heavy AI data center exposure on its balance sheet, and customer concentration risk, raising questions about how much financial strain the company...
